title: Two Steps Forward, One Step Back
description: In this week’s column, the Scholl Chair discusses supply chain resiliency and what long-term consequences the Covid-19 pandemic could have on globalization.

title: Press Briefing: Previewing the G20 Rome Summit and COP26
description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) will host a press call to preview U.S. president Biden’s trips to Italy for the 2021 G20 Rome Summit and to Glasgow for the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP26).

title: Tussle for the Amazon
description: In this report for FIU, Senior Fellow Ryan C. Berg analyzes the recent change in dynamics between Brazil's leading criminal groups, highlights features of Brazil's Amazonas state that allow these groups to thrive, and gives policy recommendations for the U.S. and Brazilian...

title: Digital Trade Agreements Present New Opportunities in Southeast Asia
description: Some parts of the Biden administration have been pushing, so far without success, a potential agreement on digital trade with key allies and partners in the Indo-Pacific, demonstrating a renewed commitment to engage with the region.

title: There and Back Again: Chinese Militia at Iroquois Reef and Union Banks
description: On September 30, the Philippines protested the presence of Chinese vessels at Iroquois Reef. Satellite imagery indicates that these ships likely came from and are headed back to Union Banks, where numbers are now approaching the levels seen in March.

title: A Discussion of U.S.-China Economic Competition
description: A a discussion on the risks and benefits of U.S.-China economic engagement, featuring keynote remarks from Congressman French Hill (AR-02), a senior member of the U.S. House Committee on Financial Services.

title: Schieffer Series: AUKUS and Its Impacts
description: CSIS's upcoming Schieffer Series installment will analyze the global impacts of the AUKUS deal.

title: The OECD and Carbon Life-Cycle Assessments
description: The global community needs a common methodology for determining carbon life-cycle assessments, an agreement the OECD should lead. A widely accepted, formally adopted methodology would reduce trade frictions, essentially harmonizing how to measure carbon footprints.

title: Degrees of Separation: A Targeted Approach to U.S.-China Decoupling – Final Report
description: This final report presents a framework for assessing U.S.-China engagement in specific economic activities along with findings from three illustrative case studies designed to test it.

title: U.S. Military Forces in FY 2022: Army
description: The U.S. Army’s force structure remains steady even though its budget declined by $3.6 billion dollars. The Army does this by cutting modernization and readiness. In the long term, the Army’s force structure is at risk because of the strategic focus on China.

title: Japan’s Hydrogen Industrial Strategy
description: Japan sees hydrogen as a key to decarbonizing its economy while sustaining its industrial competitiveness. The government and industry closely collaborate on innovation and deployment, as well as hydrogen supply chain development.

title: U.S.-Canada Energy Trade: Set for a Rebound
description: The CSIS Energy Security and Climate Change Program has partnered with the Embassy of Canada in the United States to produce a map depicting energy trade between the two countries.
